comments.body:
The output of `conda search python` looks like this:

```
python                        3.6.10      h359304d_0  pkgs/main           
python                        3.6.10      hc70fcce_1  pkgs/main           
python                        3.6.10      hf48f09d_2  pkgs/main           
python                        3.6.10      hfe9666f_1  pkgs/main           
python                        3.6.12      h26836e1_2  pkgs/main           
python                        3.6.13      h88f2d9e_0  pkgs/main           
python                         3.7.0      hc167b69_0  pkgs/main           
python                         3.7.1      haf84260_3  pkgs/main   
```

`grep -F $python_version`: Captures specified minor python versions (`-F` is required because `python_version` contains a dot)
`tail -1`: Gets the last row
`tr -s ' '`: Shrinks spaces between the columns
`cut -d' ' -f2`: Splits the row with a space and gets the second element.

diffHunk:

comments.body:
The following python versions are pre-installed in the ubuntu 20.04 image for GitHub Actions:

https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/blob/main/images/linux/Ubuntu2004-README.md#python

```
2.7.18
3.5.10
3.6.13
3.7.10
3.8.10
3.9.5
```

If we use one of these versions,  what `actions/setup-python@v2` does is just switch the active python version, which should be stabler than `conda install python=x.y`.

comments.body:
Cache key looks like this: `ubuntu20-20210419.1-wheels-20210427-9e9891b7e99e56166e9a6e511cc7a92eb80a37e6a588b0b3a5233c6881e8c32d`

Cache gets refresed when at least one of the following has changed:

1. os
2. image version
3. date
4. install command

I think `date` changes most frequently.

GitHub updates ubuntu images (about) weekly:

![Screen Shot 2021-04-29 at 10 30 14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17039389/116491915-f2351e80-a8d5-11eb-899f-2340f372b96c.png)

Repo that manages virtual environments for GitHub Actions: https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments
`ImageOS` and `ImageVersion` are pre-defined in the github actions virtual environment.

        if: ${{ matrix.package == 'pyspark' && matrix.version == 'dev' }}

comments.body:
I first tried to put `${{ matrix.install }}` in the run step like below, but it didn't work out as I expected because it contains lots of special characters (e.g. quotes, linebreaks, etc.)

```
run: |
    install_command="${{ matrix.install }}"
```

Then, I switched to using an environment variable.

comments.body: Why do we need this change?

I move ml-package-versions.yml into `mlflow` sub-directory. So that when install package, it will be installed inside the `.../site-package/mlflow/ml-package-versions.yml`
otherwise it will be installed in `.../site-package/ml-package-versions.yml`
